text:
When i try to create a variation for a blog using V3 API. Sometimes I receive  `{`
    `"code": 409,`
    `"body": {`
      `"correlationId": "XXXXXX-XXXXXX-XXXXXXXX",`
      `"errorType": "CONFLICTING_ENTRY",`
      `"message": "A conflicting entry already exists in table.",`
      `"status": "error"`
    `},`
Do we know why it occurs? Because same API works ok when i retry with no change in the request.
Hello :blush: does anyone know if there is webhooks for cms pages and blogs? Any way to trigger a function if a blog post has been created/updated/deleted?
Sadly the ticket creation is too slow for my use case so I'll have to stick with the normal ticket creation via SDK..

Hi. I am using HubSpot API files on the local react app using axios with the private app access token. I’m using Bearer authorisation and my headers settings: ‘`Content-Type': 'multipart/form-data',`
                        `'Access-Control-Allow-Origin': '*',` There, I am getting CORS errors like this. How can I solve this? (No issue using Postman)
I don’t think we’d create those types of workflows quite yet, but we may be able to retrieve this type of data from the new Data panel
is there some way I can fetch the properties that are visible in the ticket creation form in HubSpot from the api?

So the second screenshot I posted above was from MailShack's Example images and is *not* an actual set of data that we're looking for.

The first screenshot is an example of the data that we were looking for and it just says "Email Tracking" no suggestion of the word Note in it. It also shows up on the Contact Timeline. When searching notes we searched associates.contact and associates.deals with corresponding ids from both sets of objects. We didn't find any of the additional activity records, but we did find a few notes that weren't from MailShack.

I think our next steps is to reach out to MailShake and find out more about how they developed their HubSpot integration to know which object this could be found under.

Thanks for the context this will help frame our questions.

I was just checking if there was some standard set of object types to look in the dataset for around 3rd party activity feeds. I found timeline events endpoint, but that looked like I needed an appId that I couldn't seem to know where to find.
Yeah so timeline events is one but that would make it only accessible from mailshakes end
notes and other engagements are another and you would be able to access those through the api
Hey <@U0157R7AQ84> Going to nudge here again :wink:   Any timeline?
For local Dev I found that you can set a header `mode: "no-cors",` and that will resolve the CORS issue. I don't think this is best practice so if someone else has a solution I would love to know
